title:
Thermodynamic Behavior of $4D$ Regular Nonminimal Yang-Mills AdS Black
  Hole
abstract:
In this paper, we present the black hole solution of the Einstein-Yang-Mills
model incorporating a non-minimal coupling between the Ricci tensor and the
Yang-Mills field strength tensor using a perturbative method. We then explore
the thermodynamic phase transitions of the black hole within an extended phase
space, examining both canonical and grand canonical ensembles. Our findings
reveal that altering the sign of the perturbation coefficient $\lambda$ leads
to a significant shift in the thermodynamic behavior of the black hole,
transitioning between Van der Waals-like fluid phase transitions and
Hawking-Page-like transitions.
